title: Brave souls look at Moelis' strategic Japara stake
text:
There are some brave souls back sniffing around listed aged care provider Japara Healthcare.

Street Talk understands there has been some inbound interest in Moelis Australia’s strategic 13.25 per cent stake in Japara, which could be used as a toehold ahead of a larger move on the company or as a blocking stake.

The royal commission is widely expected to result in a major shake-up of the aged care industry - and a handful of buyout firms are looking for an early angle. File/Dean Mitchell

The interest appears to be sparked by prolonged depressed trading in Japara’s shares, which can be put down to a combination of company factors and sentiment towards the aged care sector as a whole. The stock is trading at 10-times forward EBITDA.

Moving on Moelis’ stake – or Japara more broadly – would be a bold move. The aged care sector is subject to a royal commission and industry players reckon it will be at least another year before there will be any concrete resolutions.

Aged care providers seem pretty confident that the royal commission will lead to improved funding conditions and that, in the end, they will get the all clear. However, there’s always a chance things could go awry.

So perhaps the tyrekicking is best viewed as a potential deep value play – or just some parties wanting to be ready for when the royal commission findings land.
